name: Crowne Plaza Birmingham City Centre

reviews.text: We visited the restaurant on several occasions and always enjoy the food and fantastic and knowledgable service there. My favourite is goat cheese salad- absolut winner!!!! The night staff at the reception is a great asset to the hotel team. Always very proffesional, nice and polite.
reviews.title: Great dinning experience!!

reviews.text: Have just returned from a 2 night stay at Crowne Plaza - there for a work training event. I requested upgrade to club before attending & was lucky enough to get it. I was in room 1012 - fabulous room with huge bed, lots of space, comfortable seating & bathroom had separate shower & bath. Club lounge was very pleasant & hotel staff were extremely helpful and courteous. Hotel is not too far away from main shopping & Bullring. Would definitely visit again socially & am hoping next year's event is at this hotel.
reviews.title: Comfortable Conference stay

reviews.text: Stayed here a couple of times on business. Its probably the best balance between quality and cost on the centre of Birmingham. Its also a 2 min stroll to the Mailbox, so the choice of restaurants and bars is decent enough.
reviews.title: Nice smart hotel, keenly priced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was going to an event at ICC , so booked to stay at the plaza which was ideally located! Our room was as one would expect giving we were paying £140 per night with access to privileged lounges on the top floor. How ever the lounge bars were closed most of the time. The main bar was in the main reception that resemble a large conference room ! Very little atmosphere ! Bar prices excessive.
reviews.title: Very very disappointing ! Poor value for money
Many good points but breakfast complete chaos
reviews.text: The next morning breakfast was a cattle market ! Continental bar was very very limited , one that resembled a 1 star hotel ! In fact they would have done a better job . There was one hot counter that couldn't cope with the volumes of people staying on a sat evening . Breakfast queues were at least 30minutes to get yourself served ! Definitely not worth the wait ! Very disappointing couldn't wait to go home
Lovely room. Shame about the view from the window.
reviews.title: Avoid the rooms next to the lifts

reviews.text: Make sure that your room is away from the many lifts or you can give up on any plans for a decent nights sleep.
reviews.title: NOT A 4 STAR BY INTERNATIONAL STANDARDS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the restaurant.
reviews.title: Good hotel apart from the drunks in next room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are other hotels in the area that I'd choose over this one.
reviews.title: Excellent location and great service

reviews.text: . WHOSE REVIEW WOULD YOU RATHER TRUST- someone who was a holiday accommodation operator for 7 years in Spain. Someone who has travelled to more than 20 destinations around the world and stayed at over 35 hotels in the last 3 years and someone who used to be a UK inspector of older people and children's social care and residential accommodation? HERE ARE MY OBSERVATIONS, EXPERIENCES AND FINDINGS. YOU ALONE CAN DECIDE IF THIS IS A PLACE YOU WANT TO STAY.
reviews.title: recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were really impressed with this hotel. Booked it on laterooms at a good price and paid £20 per night to upgrade to one of the club rooms. I'd definitely recommend this as it included wine and canapes in the evening and a very good quality continental breakfast in the morning, also fridges where we could help ourselves to water and soft drinks/mixers and a good quality coffee machine. Staff were very helpful and friendly and bed was very confortable, with bathrobes and plenty of towels. Couldn't fault it!
reviews.title: Very good hotel in great location and with friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After an effortless check in, we were sent to the 9th floor to room 909. Spacious, clean, well equipped and modern, this standard room had all that you could need. Lovely big, comfortable bed with choice of pillows. Gym was kitted out to a 'hotel' standard, but equally clean and met my needs. Parking under the hotel, with stairs to reception, this hotel is centrally located and near the mailbox, just a short walk to the Bullring and Brindley Place.
reviews.title: Room 909 - Lovely !

reviews.text: I would certainly recommend the hotel, helpful chap on reception, great rooms and am coming back in December!
reviews.title: DISGUSTING!

reviews.text: Myself and my friend had booked ourselves in for 2 nights at this hotel, in a club room with acces to the club lounge, which we were very excited about! I can now assure you that I will NEVER be back at this hotel. Our bed was FILTHY. Covered in short black curly hairs, crumbs, it was a mess. We called reception to have someone come look at the bed, and had a gentleman arrive at our door a few minutes later. His response upon inspection of the bed was "the sheet shouldn't have come off.." Excuse me, but your bedding is filthy so do not try and justify this by saying that the sheet shouldn't have come away from the bed. He then left us saying he would see if reception could change our room. We changed rooms, the manger who assisted was very apologetic and helpful, and we thought the worst of it was over. How wrong we were! This bed was even worse, covered in stains - I hate to think what the cause of these stains was! It makes my skin crawl. Again we informed the reception and the manager came back to the room with two members of house keeping staff to strip our bed and replace the linen. We appreciated the apologies however did not feel the "I'd rather be anywhere than here" mood from the house keeping staff was necessary. After our bed was changed, we thought we would venture along to the club lounge and enjoy a cup of tea before bed (it was already after 11:30 by this point, NOT how we had wanted to spend our Friday night there changing rooms), and when we entered the club lounge, my what a sight! Dirty wine glasses on every table, no cups, saucers or clean glasses available for drinks.. Needless to say we felt it was a lost cause and just left.
reviews.title: The Hyatt is next door, stay there instead.

reviews.text: We spoke to the Duty Manager on shift the following morning, who was already aware of our issues, and again we appreciated the apologies. She was very understanding, and after we had enjoyed a pleasant day shopping we were surprised on our return to find a bottle of wine in our room.
reviews.title: Excellent hospitality. A pleasure.
Great place to stay, great location
reviews.text: We stayed here on our annual visit to the Christmas Markets and party with our friends. We have stayed in a different hotel every year but I think we have found our place for future years. The location is great, friendly efficient staff, and the rooms were clean, nicely presented and a great bed. No complaints at all other Thani could have stayed another night in that bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we are in Birmingham for an event at the NIA,we usually book a room here as it is only a 10 minute walk to the arena that includes a pleasant stroll along the canal system.
reviews.title: Great stay for NIA events.

reviews.text: The hotel is not in the prettiest of locations and is surrounded by high rise flats and other hotels,but that is what is expected of a city based hotel I suppose.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.text: The front entrance and reception area are a good first impression as is the bar and restaurant adjacent to check in desks. The receptionist was pleasant and efficient but as I noticed last time we stayed here,the staff don't seem to want to smile or be friendly. Very professional but straight to the point and all business. I watched the interaction with other staff and customers who they were helping and noticed the same thing. Perhaps there is a sign in the staff break room telling them smiling is forbidden. Come on management, they don't cost any extra.
reviews.title: Good location & quiet room

reviews.text: The lifts,hallways etc are all very clean and kept up well.
reviews.title: A good choice

likes.disliked: — being charged for wifi and no bath

aka: Crowne Plaza Birmingham City Centre Hotel Birmingham
description: The Crowne Plaza Birmingham City is a 4 star deluxe property, conveniently located in the heart of Birmingham City Centre. Birmingham New Street Station, The ICC, NIA and new shopping developments are just a short walk away. Events coming soon-Cirque Du Soleil and Dancing on Ice. The hotel has 312 spacious bedrooms with a variety of amenities including en suite facilities, air conditioning, in room dining, satellite TV and refreshment making facilities as standard.A range of flexible food and beverage options are available to guests in our vibrant, contemporary B1 Bar and Restaurant and 24 hour room service, all of which offer creative menus with healthy options to suit all tastes. Overall, the Crowne Plaza Birmingham City offers great quality accommodation and facilities with service to match - we guarantee an enjoyable experience to all our guests!
